content: It seems that what rustc is doing in #90970 is generally the right thing to do; as such, I could address that particular issue either by doing some combination of 1) special-casing byte literals to suggest using a char if that would resolve the error, 2) Pattern to not emit this type of help message at all, and/or 3) not provide a help message recommending Fn* if there are other types that would fulfill the trait bound. I might experiment with all 3, but I would appreciate any guidance on which ones seem like better/worse ideas.

You might want to provide a new ObligationCauseCode that wraps the original obligation when more than one are found, and use that to customize the option and only talk about Pattern instead of the specific impl that was found last.
